job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: The students, a great staff of lower administration workers and  the location.
cons:
New administration has fired a lot of people  under the blanket of "restructuring." It is apparent to many some of these firings were spurred out of a personal nature rather than professional integrity. The current morale is depleted, especially when combined with a lack of vision, transparency, and knowledge of current higher administration whom seem to know little about operating a college outside the realms of the classroom. 

The Human Resources Department does not advocate or represent staff in an un-bias manner. The department abuses their power and, because they felt "hurt" by  someone, have demanded apologies and brought trivial matters to higher administration without being restorative or introspective. This department also wrongfully "investigates" and "interrogates" people who question their practice, autonomy, agenda, and honesty. The most disheartening part is the fact that this department wields  their "Christian" faith like an axe yet somehow miss the Gospel. 

Please think and pray long and hard about working at this institution. I am not an employee who was terminated but rather left on my own terms. However, experiencing and witnessing what I have there has kept my therapist in business.

review_title: It's hard to work at all when you have a hypercritical micromanager always looking over your shoulder
job_title: Security Desk Worker in Bronxville, NY
pros: Community..the work place was fun only because of the coworkers and never because of the administration
cons: In order to cut costs the administration chooses the least expensive or the best choice in plumbing, heat, electrical..and then when everything goes wrong it is the employees fault.
